situations.situationDescription: You need a reason for skipping a family meal.
You forgot someone’s birthday and need an excuse.
You need to cancel your scheduled weekend visit with relatives.
You need to delay or avoid a tough relationship conversation.
You completely forgot your relationship anniversary and didn't make any plans to celebrate.
You need to call off your planned date night.
You can’t finish your work project by the deadline.
You overslept and missed a work meeting.
You need to stay late at work on short notice.
You missed paying back a financial loan on time.
You accidentally spent more than your checking account balance, triggering overdraft fees.
Your credit card was declined at the store due to a suspected fraud hold.
You need to postpone your medical appointment.
You got hit with an overdraft fee and need to explain.
You skipped your daily prescription and need to explain to your doctor.
Your flight was delayed and you need to notify someone.
Your baggage didn’t arrive—explaining why you’re unprepared.
You didn’t submit your homework on time.
You arrived late to your lecture.

excuses.excuseDescription: I'm feeling under the weather and don't want to risk getting anyone sick.
Got stuck at work dealing with a sudden issue. I’m so sorry — can we reschedule soon?
I just got a call that my neighbor’s child is having an asthma attack—I need to stay here until help arrives.
There’s a small gas leak in my kitchen and the repairman is here now—can’t risk staying until it’s fixed.
I’m stranded at the train station—the last train was delayed and I can’t get back in time.
My building’s basement flooded and I need to help my landlord sort it out right away.
I accidentally sat on my car keys and now they’re singing metal under my jeans—can’t find them anywhere!
My cat decided to hide in my suitcase and now I’m refusing to move until she emerges.
I tried to make pancakes and somehow ended up with a smoke alarm concerto—must sort this kitchen chaos first!
I’m locked in my apartment playing hide-and-seek with a rogue spider; negotiations are ongoing.
My Fitbit thinks I’ve already done 20,000 steps today and refuses to let me move until I rest.
I've been so caught up with work/family stuff — but I didn’t forget you’re important to me!
I wanted to be the last person to wish you a happy birthday — saving the best for last!
I thought your birthday was on the 14th, not the 15th—my calendar app must be playing tricks on me!
My phone died last night and erased all my reminders—but that doesn’t erase how much I care about you!
I figured you deserved a belated surprise—think of this as an extended birthday celebration!
I’ve been so busy time-traveling through my to-do list that I completely lost track of what day it is!
I signed up for an all-day meditation retreat and apparently lost all sense of time—hope your day was amazing!
I’m so sorry I let your birthday slip by—my notification settings glitched overnight, and I didn’t see the reminder, but that’s on me entirely.
My phone’s calendar accidentally reset and wiped my reminders; I just saw your birthday notice now—sorry for the belated wish!
I had to deal with a minor health scare yesterday and was a bit out of it—feel awful for missing your special day.
I tried building a birthday robot surprise that ended up locking me in my workshop—escaped just now to wish you a happy birthday!
A last-minute work emergency popped up; I’ll have to rain-check this weekend.
My car broke down on the way – I’m arranging a tow now, so sorry!
My doctor just called with urgent test results—I need to go in for a follow-up right away.
I had a severe allergic reaction this morning and am stuck in the ER until they clear me.
A water pipe burst in my kitchen and the plumber can only come this afternoon—can’t leave until it’s fixed.
My neighbor’s elderly dad fell and I promised to stay until the ambulance arrives.
I agreed to help my uncle move an old piano this weekend—it’s taking way longer than expected.
My GPS insisted today was tomorrow and sent me in circles—I’m finally back on track but too late for the visit!
My cat stole my car keys and won’t give them back—I’m bargaining with drastic cat treats over here.
I offered to help a neighbor change a tire and somehow we’re replacing the whole wheel—won’t be done until tomorrow!
Tried to whip up a surprise brunch before heading out and set off the smoke alarm—in full evacuation mode now.
My Fitbit declared today a mandatory rest day and refuses to let me move until I hit 10,000 steps… paradoxical, I know.
I’m emotionally exhausted today and don’t want to make things worse—can we talk tomorrow?
I have a work emergency tonight, can we postpone our conversation?
I need some time to cool off before we discuss things—my emotions are too raw right now.
I need some time to cool off before we discuss things—my emotions are too raw right now.
My friend’s shift got canceled last minute and I promised to cover—stuck at work until late, I’m so sorry.
My car alarm’s been going off non-stop and I’m in crisis mode figuring out how to turn it off—will call you once I’m sorted.
I’ve got a migraine brewing and don’t want to say things I’ll regret—let’s reschedule when I’m clear-headed.
My hamster’s having an existential crisis and I’m the only one who can calm it down—can we chat once I’ve restored its faith in life?
I spilled coffee all over my laptop and now I’m playing tech doctor to revive it—can we postpone our talk until it’s stable?
My GPS insisted today was Sunday and sent me on a wild goose chase—I’m still finding my way back home.
My neighbor’s parrot learned to mimic crying and it’s a full-blown opera next door—I need to negotiate a ceasefire before we talk.
My best friend texted that they’re locked in a bathroom and I’m on rescue duty—can we push our conversation until I’ve performed a successful extraction?
My headache’s killing me right now—I need some rest, rain-check our date?
My friend just went into labour—gotta head to the hospital asap!
My apartment plumbing just burst and I’m knee-deep in water—can’t leave until the plumber arrives.
My nephew’s fever spiked and I’m on babysitter duty at the ER—so sorry but I can’t make tonight.
My dog ate the only shirt I planned to wear—I’m scrambling to find something presentable!
I just realized I’m highly allergic to those fresh flowers I bought—my face is swelling up already.
I accidentally double-booked myself with a work call—hate to bail, but I need to reschedule.
I just set off a popcorn tornado in my kitchen—now I’m buried under fluffy chaos and can’t escape!
My neighbor’s cat decided to have a meowing concert on my balcony and I’m on standby with tuna—rescue mission in progress!
My plants staged a rebellion and have overtaken my hallway—I’m hacking through vines with a kitchen knife!
My Fitbit declared today a ‘couch potato intervention’ and won’t let me leave until I finish a marathon of steps… paradoxical, I know.
I’m stuck in an intense yoga pose—apparently I can’t move until I master ‘Ultimate Beginner’s Pretzel’. Send help!
Technical blockers came up unexpectedly — I’ll need a brief extension to deliver quality work.
My laptop crashed last night and corrupted critical files. I’m working on recovery
Stakeholders submitted last-minute change requests to the requirements, and I need time to incorporate them properly.
A critical vendor deliverable arrived late and I’m blocked until it’s resolved—requesting a brief extension.
My key teammate is out sick and I’m covering both our parts of the project—will need extra time to finish.
We encountered unexpected data integration issues during testing and I’m troubleshooting the root cause now.
Our server environment went down this morning and IT is on it—resuming work as soon as systems are back online.
I discovered my keyboard was stuck in emoji-only mode and had to spend hours translating every line of code back into English.
I spilled my entire coffee pot into the server rack—IT has quarantined me and the servers until further notice.
My dog chewed through the USB drive containing all my work—I’m negotiating a truce and data recovery plan now.
I uncovered a ‘ghost bug’ in the code that only appears at midnight—it’s taking a full exorcism to remove it.
The building elevator seized with me inside—I’m currently my own IT support and maintenance waiting list.
Alarm didn’t go off due to a phone update glitch — so sorry for missing the meeting!
Alarm didn’t go off due to a phone update glitch — so sorry for missing the meeting!
I accidentally set my alarm for PM instead of AM—just realized the mistake, so sorry I missed the call.
My toddler woke up crying non-stop and I had to calm them down before I could even reach my phone.
There was a brief blackout and my backup generator failed—was off-grid until just now.
My smart alarm glitched during its overnight update and never rang—deeply sorry for oversleeping.
A critical bug popped up in production—I’m triaging it tonight.
Our key stakeholder requested last-minute changes—keeping me late.
Our on-call pager just went off with a high-priority incident—I'm triaging it now and won't be done until it's fully resolved.
The data center reported an unexpected outage this afternoon—I'm coordinating the recovery effort on-site.
A partner vendor delivered a critical report late, and I'm reviewing it to ensure we meet compliance standards.
Our quarterly audit team just arrived unannounced—I need to assist them with documentation until they wrap up.
I’ve been asked to stay for an urgent executive briefing on tomorrow’s deliverables—won’t be out of the office until late.
Our office coffee machine exploded a geyser of espresso—facilities won’t let me leave until the clean-up crew arrives.
The photocopier jammed under a mountain of paper—I’m here playing paper mountain rescuer until further notice.
I borrowed the IT hat and now I’m stuck untangling a spaghetti mess of network cables—won’t escape until every cable’s back in order.
Our office plant staged a hostile takeover of the conference room—HR says I have to broker peace before heading home.
The emergency lights started blinking in Morse code and I’m duty-bound to decode its message before I can log off.
Bank processing delays caused a problem. I’ll clear the payment within 24 hours.
Unexpected medical expenses popped up this week. I need a little more time.
My autopay bounced because the account number was entered incorrectly—it’s been fixed and the payment will clear today.
I had to cover an unexpected car repair this morning; I’ll have the loan payment processed within the next 48 hours.
I was locked out of my banking app after too many PIN attempts—the reset process takes about a day, so I’ll send the payment as soon as I regain access.
My checkbook got buried under a mountain of paperwork—I'm digging it out now and will mail the payment by end of day.
The bank’s system went down for maintenance and all outgoing transfers are delayed—I’ll retry first thing tomorrow.
I tried to pay the loan but accidentally sent it to my cousin’s pet-sitting business—now I’m on a treasure hunt to get it back.
My home AI assistant heard “pay loan” as “play lawn” and started mowing the yard at 2 AM—I’m still negotiating reboot terms.
I attempted to use voice banking but my dog decided to bark his approval instead—bank thought I was under duress and froze my account.
I accidentally paid my coffee subscription instead of the loan—I’ll need to redirect funds once caffeine kicks in properly.
My checkbook sprouted legs and walked off—I’m organizing a search party but expect the payment later today.
My direct deposit was delayed—bank didn’t post it in time.
An automated payment hit unexpectedly—didn’t realize my balance was low.
I scheduled my transfer for next month by mistake—thought it was this cycle, so the fee hit before my deposit.
An unexpected emergency dental bill posted yesterday morning—my deposit hadn’t arrived yet to cover it.
My spouse used the joint card for groceries and I forgot to update our budget—sorry I didn’t catch the low balance in time.
The bank’s mobile app displayed the wrong balance after an update glitch—I relied on it and got hit with the fee.
A charity donation I scheduled earlier cleared today instead of last week—didn’t realize my account was that low.
I tipped my barista with my last cent and now my account’s stage-diving into overdraft territory.
My phone auto-paid my subscription to ‘Invisible Yacht Club’—still waiting for my imaginary yacht to arrive.
I accidentally bought 1,000 ‘mystery boxes’ online—turns out they were 99 cents each and drained my account.
My smart fridge overheard ‘order snacks’ and went on a midnight shopping spree—apparently it’s a foodie now.
I sponsored a snail-racing league on a whim—didn’t check the entry fees before cheering them on.
My insurance authorization fell through—can we pick a new date?
I’m still recovering from my last visit—need another week before I can come in.
I woke up with a sudden allergic reaction and need to monitor it for another day—can we reschedule?
My child’s school just called—there’s been an incident and I need to pick them up immediately.
The clinic’s system double-booked my slot and they asked me to come later—what time works for you next week?
I realized I’m due for an important work webinar at the same time—can we find another slot?
The doctor’s office called to say they’re awaiting new test results—looks like I need to come back after they arrive.
My smart pill dispenser went rogue and locked me out—I’m negotiating peaceful access back to my meds before I can leave.
I tried to video-call in and accidentally activated a filter that turned me into a potato—doctor couldn’t take me seriously!
My fitness tracker said I’m already ‘too healthy’ and refused to let me out the door—apparently I need more rest.
My dog hid my car keys in protest of vet visits—I’m on a top-secret mission to retrieve them from under the couch.
I accidentally turned my calendar notifications off with one sneeze—only just realized I’m late for my own appointment!
I changed routines and accidentally left my pills at home.
My pill organizer was misplaced during travel—just found it now.
I was juggling back-to-back appointments and my pill organizer got buried under my paperwork—just uncovered it now.
I felt perfectly fine this morning and skipped it by mistake—realized only when evening rolled around.
My travel bag zipper jammed shut overnight with my meds inside—I had to carefully unstick it before I could take them.
I thought I’d refilled my prescription last week but discovered the bottle was empty—ran out and just got my refill today.
I set an alarm reminder but my phone auto-silenced overnight—I didn’t wake up until much later.
My smart speaker misheard “take meds” as “play Mads”—it blasted heavy metal until I missed my dose.
I woke up cocooned in my blanket burrito and couldn’t unroll in time to reach my pills.
My cat staged a hostage situation with my pills hidden under the couch—I'm in delicate negotiations.
I thought my dog buried my pills as a treasure—spent the morning digging up the backyard.
My goldfish gave me the side-eye all morning—I decided to prioritize emotional support before meds.
I’ve been hit with a migraine so bad I can barely see—have to lie down immediately, sorry to miss dinner.
Air traffic control held us an extra hour—apologies for the delay!
Our connecting flight was late—this gate change slowed us down.
Crew duty time limits required us to wait for a fresh team before departure.
Heavy fog at our destination reduced visibility—air traffic control has us on hold.
Routine maintenance flagged a minor hydraulic issue and technicians are resolving it now.
De-icing trucks were delayed by a backlog—our turn finally came but pushed us behind schedule.
A fellow passenger had a medical emergency; we waited on the tarmac for paramedics.
The airport coffee machine went on strike until we met its espresso quota—barista negotiations are still ongoing!
My suitcase joined a conga line down the terminal and I’ve been chasing it ever since.
The gate agent challenged me to a dance-off for priority boarding—I’m still perfecting my moves.
My GPS in the airport sent me to the wrong terminal and I ended up exploring the ‘lost and found’ jungle.
A flock of very determined seagulls staged a protest on the runway—we’re waiting on animal control.
Looks like my bag went to the wrong carousel—filing a report now.
Customs held my luggage for extra inspection—sorry I’m running late.
The airline misplaced my bag tag and my luggage is on a joyride to who-knows-where—I’m working with lost & found now.
My suitcase got zip-locked shut by TSA for a random security check—I’m waiting for them to clear it.
A fellow passenger’s bag was identical to mine and we swapped them by accident—I’m sorting it out at the carousel.
My luggage took an unscheduled detour through three other countries before realizing the mistake—I’ve filed an international alert.
The baggage handlers are treating my bag like a VIP—it’s still in the lounge and won’t join the main party until later.
My suitcase decided to go on a solo vacation and is currently lounging poolside in Miami—tracking its Instagram now.
I caught my bag trying to sneak onto a cargo ship bound for Antarctica—airline’s issuing a rescue mission.
Customs stamped ‘VIP only’ on my luggage and it’s sipping champagne in the First Class lounge.
My bag joined a flash mob in baggage claim and I’m still negotiating its release choreography.
The baggage carousel has unionized and is on strike until they get better tips—my bag’s picketing right now.
I misunderstood the due date—thought it was next week!
My computer crashed while saving—lost half my work.
My pet goldfish swam into my laptop bag and knocked my flash drive into the filter—still fishing files out!
I volunteered at a last-minute charity event and got so caught up helping that I lost track of all deadlines.
I sneezed so hard while dusting my desk that I knocked my notes off and can’t find a single page.
I thought the submission portal closed at midnight, but it actually shut at 8 PM—my bad on the timing!
I got stuck in an elevator on campus—just got out and logged in to submit, but it’s too late now.
My laptop thought it was April Fools’ Day and hid my assignment in a prank folder—I’ve been searching ever since!
My hamster chewed through my charger cable overnight—my computer conked out before I could submit.
I taught my parrot to hand in my assignment, but it flew off with it to the park—still trying to negotiate retrieval!
I tried submitting via voice-to-text, but my dog’s enthusiastic barking got transcribed instead of my essay.
I tried submitting via voice-to-text, but my dog’s enthusiastic barking got transcribed instead of my essay.
My smart assistant misheard 'upload assignment' as 'undo assignment' and reversed all my progress—classic tech fail.
My bus broke down on the way—jumped on a taxi but got delayed.
Traffic was backed up due to an accident—sorry I couldn’t make it on time.
My alarm went off but I hit snooze one too many times—woke up in a panic when I saw the time!
I accidentally wandered into the wrong lecture hall and realized it halfway through—by then the bell had already rung.
My roommate locked me out of our dorm by mistake—I had to wait for them to find the spare key.
I tripped over my untied shoelace on the stairs and twisted my ankle—had to catch my breath before I could continue.
My pet parakeet flew off with my lecture notes and I spent half the morning coaxing it back.
I tried sprinting to class but my shoelaces betrayed me—face-planted right outside the lecture hall.
My backpack zipper gave up the ghost and spilled all my things—spent ten minutes herding pens and papers back in.
I mistook my alarm tone for my cat’s meow and spent five minutes searching for a phantom feline.
My neighbor decided to practice tuba at 8 AM—was stuck in a brass duet until I could escape the noise.
I got trapped in a crowd of tourists taking selfies on campus—I’m basically a reluctant photo bomb.
My company’s payroll system glitched and my salary deposit was delayed—I just got the funds this morning.
I was hit with an unexpected medical bill yesterday and had to sort that first before transferring the loan payment.
My bank app crashed right at the moment I tried to pay; it finally worked after their support rebooted their servers.
There was a fraud alert freeze on my account—I had to verify several transactions before I could release the payment.
I was traveling abroad and my bank blocked the transfer for security; I’ve just authorized it now.
My roommate accidentally used the money I set aside for the loan—I've already covered it and it’s going out today.
My internet was down all day due to a local outage—couldn’t access online banking until just now.
I misread the due date on my calendar—totally my mistake, and the payment is processing as we speak.
I was waiting on a small tax refund to cover the last bit of the payment—it arrived today and I cleared the loan.
My co-signer and I had a miscommunication on who was supposed to pay today—it's settled now and payment is on its way.
The terminal had a software update in the middle of my purchase and the chip wouldn't read until it rebooted.
My card’s magnetic stripe got demagnetized when my phone speaker was in my wallet pocket overnight.
I accidentally left my travel notice on for Europe instead of switching back to domestic, so my bank flagged the transaction.
I was on a call with my bank’s fraud department about another charge and they paused my card for my own protection—just got it reactivated.
My toddler thought my wallet was a coloring book and drew all over my card, making it unreadable—sorry about that!
I forgot to notify my bank after cancelling a subscription with the same merchant name, so they thought this purchase was suspicious.
The store’s chip reader was misaligned; I had to try three times and only succeeded when I switched to the other register.
I had just canceled a recurring payment to a similarly named vendor, so my bank froze this one thinking it was fraudulent.
I grabbed my expired card by mistake, tried to pay, and only realized after it declined that I needed the new one.
I set my daily spending limit too low in my banking app and this purchase went just over the threshold.
I accidentally booked an important work meeting in our time slot—just got it moved!
My phone’s calendar glitched and deleted the reminder—it just pinged me now.
I thought we agreed on a low-key dinner tonight, not last night; my bad on the date mix-up.
My fitness tracker battery died and it resets my anniversaries like a stubborn toddler.
I saw a shooting star and made a wish, but I wished for more time to plan, not to forget!
Google Maps sent me to the wrong restaurant for our date; I just realized the mix-up.
My roommate threw away the flowers I bought; they looked suspiciously wilted in the fridge.
I was convinced I already sent your gift; turns out it’s still in my drafts folder.
My dog hid the card I wrote for you—he thought it was a chew toy.
I had you on “one day beyond” in my head thanks to leap year confusion—clearly I miscalculated.

reviews.comment: This text excuse about being under the weather was spot-on—empathetic and believable!
The quick one-liner for skipping a meeting was concise and funny. Loved the playful tone!
The photo-based excuse worked OK, but felt a bit over the top for my boss.
The tone was too formal for a family dinner—needed something more casual.
Perfect! The brief text format excuse for missing a workout was realistic and saved me.
The image excuse fell flat—my audience didn’t get the point and asked questions instead.
Loved the empathetic tone in this text excuse for missing class. Felt natural.
Funny format, but the silly tone didn’t fit my manager’s style.
The text-only excuse for a doctor’s appointment was clear, polite, and exactly what I needed.
Good mix of humor and brevity—this GIF-style excuse got a laugh and got me out early.
